intro: Poecilanthe fluminensis, commonly known as the Brazilian star jasmine, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has glossy, dark green leaves and thrives in tropical and subtropical climates. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and pleasant scent. Poecilanthe fluminensis is also used in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
